New Records: David Warner and Mitch Marsh hit a record-breaking 259-run opening stand in a World Cup match
Key Match Events: Mitch Marsh scored his first ODI century since January 2016
Adam Zampa claimed 4-53 to set off a late collapse
Marcus Stoinis dismissed Abdullah Shafique for 64 and Imam-ul-Huq for 70
Pre-Game Insights: Australia's World Cup campaign is back on track
David Warner and Mitch Marsh found form to power Australia to a 62-run win over Pakistan
Adam Zampa rose from his sick bed to bowl well
Post-Match Reflections: Pat Cummins praised the opening stand of Warner and Marsh
Cummins acknowledged the importance of taking 80-odd runs in the powerplay
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan needed 100 from 68 balls to win
Haris Rauf gave away 3-83 from eight overs
